Hi,
I don't know the exact problem. Because your classpath detail is 
incomplete one. I guess, you should add .;(for current directory)at 
your classpath along with other entries.
I hope this may help you.
excuse my english.
Suresh.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "bill_leang" <bill_leang@y...> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi,
>   I'm new to JUnit, and having trouble installing. Although i've 
> unzipped the file to a folder in C:, and use "set CLASSPATH = C:\.." 
> (and even go to Control Panel|System|Advanced tab|Environment 
Variable 
> to edit the PATH variable to include the path to the folder, I still 
> couldn't run the installation test. The error was "Exception in the 
> thread "main" Java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:> 
junit/textui/TestRunner"
> It seems like the computer couldn't find the test files. Please 
Help :)
>   Sincerely,
>   Bob
